data.title: missing geotagging info in photos taken w…
data.text:
previously on any iPhone photo taken with location enabled, I could see the GPS coordinates by command-I either in Finder or Preview, and the coordinates would be visible for photos I exported to Lightroom; now the GPS coordinates simply are invisible in any of the 3 above; yet in Photos pix taken with the XS still map to Apple Maps so presumably geotagging is working just the coordinates are no longer visible; whether this is to do with the XS or the latest version of Mojave or some weird setting, I don't know

so the q is: is there a way to reveal the GPS coordinates with photos taken with an iPhone XS?

thanks

Nick

unfortunately the GPS tag in Preview is simply missing; I see this:

ah, very weird; in Photos I see this:

which is kind of useless...

and in the Lightroom imported version of the photo I also see no GPS info; I see:

but if I export the pic from Photos as unmodified then suddenly the GPS info appears! and I see this:

which solves the problem though it makes no sense to me at least why I can't see the same info in the ways I used to be able to see it - in Preview, Lightroom and in Photos...

thanks

Nick

unfortunately the GPS tag in Preview is simply missing; I see this:

ah, very weird; in Photos I see this:

which is kind of useless...

and in the Lightroom imported version of the photo I also see no GPS info; I see:

but if I export the pic from Photos as unmodified then suddenly the GPS info appears! and I see this:

which solves the problem though it makes no sense to me at least why I can't see the same info in the ways I used to be able to see it - in Preview, Lightroom and in Photos...

thanks

Nick

You should be seeing the GPS tags in Preview, if you open the photos in Preview and and use Tools > inspector.

I noticed too, that the Info in the Finder is not always showing all metadata tags. On Mojave I am seeing the GPS in the Finder usually in column mode below the Preview.

How did you edit the photo? If you used an external editor, it might not have added the GpS to the preview. Have you enabled the checkmark to include the location info, when you export the edited version with “file > export ... photos” ? If you simply drag a photo to the Desktop, the metadata may not be included.
